channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure feature updates policy for Windows devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and manage Intune policy for Windows feature updates. Configure and deploy policy to maintain the Windows feature version of Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, administrative templates (ADMX), and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Install the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to install and configure the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Configure a tenant-wide Windows Hello for Business policy with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Apply policy for Windows Hello for Business on devices at the time they enroll with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Overview of Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Azure - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Configure compliance policies with actions for noncompliance in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your compliance policies with one or more actions for noncompliance to protect devices and your organization from unprotected devices. Actions can remotely lock devices, send email or notifications to device users, and more.

item.title: Types of certificate that are supported by Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Microsoft Intune's support for Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP), Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates.

item.title: Learn about Intune security baselines for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy security baselines that have preset and recommended configurations to the Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create trusted certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and deploy trusted certificate profiles to deploy a trusted root certificate to managed devices in Intune. Trusted certificate profiles support use of Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) and Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center copy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices copy.

item.title: Prerequisites for the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the software and network prerequisites for use of the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about Windows Driver updates policy for Windows devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about using Microsoft Intune policy to manage Windows driver updates.

item.title: Encrypt macOS FileVault disk encryption with Intune policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to configure FileVault on macOS devices, and use the admin center to manage their recovery keys.

item.title: Use the settings catalog to configure DDM software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Apple's declarative device management (DDM) settings to install a specific update by an enforced deadline. This feature uses the settings catalog to configure managed software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS and managed macOS devices.

item.title: Create device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Defender for Endpoint in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune as a Mobile Threat Defense solution.

item.title: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel VPN solution for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway, a VPN server for Intune that runs on Linux. With Microsoft Tunnel, cloud-based devices you manage with Intune can reach your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Third-party device compliance partners support in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party device compliance partner as a source of compliance data for devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Set up device-based Conditional Access policies with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a device-based Conditional Access policy that uses device status from a Microsoft Intune device compliance policies.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies to manage macOS software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised macOS devices.

item.title: Scenarios for using Conditional Access with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Conditional Access is commonly used with Intune compliance policy for devices and apps

item.title: Create discovery scripts for custom compliance policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create scripts for Linux or Windows devices to discover the settings you define as custom compliance settings for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View report details for encryption status of devices managed with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to view reports for device encryption status across macOS FileVault and Windows BitLocker encrypted devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use app-based Conditional Access policies with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about using app-based Conditional Access policies with Microsoft Intune for both enrolled and unenrolled devices.

item.title: Create Windows Driver updates policy in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage policies that install Windows driver updates on your Intune managed Windows devices.

item.title: Use Intune to remediate vulnerabilities found by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune Security Tasks to manage threats and vulnerabilities identified by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

item.title: Send notifications to noncompliant devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this topic, you use Microsoft Intune to send email notifications to noncompliant devices.

item.title: Create a JSON file for custom compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create the JSON file that defines custom settings and values for use with device compliance policies in Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Cloud PKI root and issuing CA for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a root and issuing CA for the Microsoft Cloud PKI service.

item.title: Protect devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune capabilities that can help you protect your devices and data against unauthorized access and other threats.

item.title: Tutorial - Use Microsoft Intune to protect Exchange Online email from unmanaged iOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune app protection policies and Conditional Access to prevent unmanaged iOS devices from accessing Exchange Online.

item.title: Deployment models for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the deployment options for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Admin checklist for iOS/iPadOS software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune. See sample policy for different industry scenarios, including shared devices, kiosk, manufacturing, and information worker.

item.title: Android FOTA Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage firmware updates on Android devices. A FOTA update can include software and security patches, feature updates, and other changes to the device's firmware.

item.title: Bring your own certificate authority with Cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a Microsoft Cloud PKI BYOCA issuing CA in Intune and anchor it to an on-premises or private CA.

item.title: Remove SCEP or PKCS certificates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the actions that can remove, revoke, or leave untouched the certificates on a device that were provisioned by Intune certificate profiles. Actions include tasks to wipe or retire a managed device, to unenroll a device, manage the certificate profile assignment, and more.

item.title: View the Android device administrator compliance settings for Microsoft Intune compliance policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings that are available for Android device administrator devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune cloud PKI fundamentals - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes fundamentals for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Configure the Jamf Pro Cloud Connector to integrate Jamf Pro with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Jamf Cloud Connector to integrate Jamf Pro with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Android (AOSP) compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for Android (AOSP) that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Admin checklist for Android software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for Android devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on corporate owned Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Admin checklist for software updates on BYOD in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for BYOD and personally owned devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on personal devices on Android and iOS/iPadOS platforms.

item.title: Set up SentinelOne MTD with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the SentinelOne Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Monitor the Microsoft Tunnel VPN solution for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor the status of Microsoft Tunnel Gateway, a VPN server that runs on Linux. Microsoft Tunnel enables your Intune managed cloud-based devices to reach your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Upgrade the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway server software - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how Microsoft Tunnel Gateway upgrades to new versions of the tunnel software for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Privacy and personal data in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn what personal data is collected and processed in Intune.

item.title: Configure Defender for Endpoint Web protection on Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender for Endpoint web protection settings on Android devices managed by Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Endpoint protection settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create Endpoint protection settings when you create a macOS or Windows 10 device profile in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies with tenant attached Configuration Manager devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use tenant attach to add Configuration Manager devices to Microsoft Intune and then deploy Intune policies to those devices.

item.title: View reports for Windows LAPS policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to view reports and details for Windows Local Administrator Policy Solution (LAPS) policies.

item.title: Audit, export or delete personal data collected by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to audit, export, or delete personal data that is collected by Intune.

item.title: Issue DigiCert PKCS certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Install and configure the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune to issue PKCS certificates from DigiCert PKI Platform to Intune-managed devices.

item.title: Use Microsoft Tunnel VPN with Android devices that don't enroll with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add support for Mobile Application Management (MAM) for Android to the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. Tunnel support for MAM expands access to your organizational resources for devices that can't or haven't enrolled with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Create Mobile Threat Defense compliance policies in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create an Intune device compliance policy that uses your MTD partner threat levels to determine if a mobile device can access company resources.

item.title: Monitor security baselines deployed by Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor device and per-setting results of security baselines you deploy with Microsoft Intune, and identify conflicts for devices.

item.title: Data storage and processing in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how personal data is stored and processed in Intune.

item.title: Use CrowdStrike Falcon for Mobile with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up CrowdStrike Falcon Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Enable Mobile Threat Defense connector in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable the connector between your Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) partner and Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) app protection policy with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) app protection policy with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Compliance for Windows Subsystem for Linux - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Evaluate WSL attributes on a host device for compliance.

item.title: Monitor issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor reports for certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Prevent data leaks on non-managed devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Allow access to corporate data on devices and protect data from data leaks using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up CrowdStrike Falcon for Mobile integration with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up CrowdStrike Falcon Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Monitor your Endpoint Privilege Management policies for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View reports for managed and unmanaged file elevations when you use Endpoint Privilege Management for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Delete issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Delete certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Use Microsoft Tunnel VPN gateway with Conditional Access policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Azure tenant to support using Conditional Access policies to grant access to the Intune Microsoft Tunnel VPN gateway solution.

item.title: Add Mobile Threat Defense apps to unenrolled devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add Mobile Threat Defense apps to unenrolled devices by device users.

item.title: SentinelOne MTD connector with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up SentinelOne Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Enable the Mobile Threat Defense connector for unenrolled devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable the Mobile Threat Defense connector in Microsoft Intune for unenrolled devices.

item.title: Set up Zimperium MTD integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the Zimperium Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Monitor Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Intune, including device compliance and onboarding status.

item.title: Set up Lookout Mobile Endpoint Security with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Lookout Mobile Endpoint Security and Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Optional diagnostic data that is collected by Intune client apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the optional diagnostic data that Intune Client apps collect.

item.title: Lookout Mobile Endpoint with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Lookout Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) How to set up to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Zimperium MTD connector with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Zimperium Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources

item.title: View and correct personal data collected by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to view and correct personal data that's been collected by Intune.

item.title: Set up Sophos Mobile integration with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the Sophos Mobile solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Trend Micro Mobile Security and Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Trend Micro Mobile Threat Defense with with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources

item.title: Set up Check Point Harmony integration with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up CheckPoint Harmony Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Set up Jamf Mobile Threat Protection integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the Jamf Mobile Threat Protection solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Set up Jamf Mobile Security with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Jamf Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Better Mobile Threat Defense with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the Better Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources

item.title: Windows 8.1 compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for Windows 8.1 that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection Mobile connector with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Symantec Endpoint Protection Mobile with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Managing Elevation Settings for Endpoint Privilege Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View guidance on how to manage the Endpoint Privilege Management client, including reporting level and default elevation response.

item.title: Use Conditional Access with Microsoft Intune compliance policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Combine Conditional Access with Intune compliance policies to define the requirements that users and devices must meet before gaining access your organizations resources.

item.title: Encrypt Windows devices with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to manage encryption of Windows devices with either BitLocker or Personal Data Encryption.

item.title: Linux device compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for Linux that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Use imported PFX certificates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use imported Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates with Microsoft Intune. Import certificates, configure certificate templates, and create an Imported PKCS Certificate profile.

item.title: Onboard and Configure Devices with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint via Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune, including connecting the products, onboarding devices, and assigning policies for compliance and risk level assessment.

item.title: Tutorial - Protect Exchange Online email on managed iOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn to secure Exchange Online with iOS Intune compliance policies and Microsoft Entra Conditional Access to require managed devices and the Outlook app.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to manage software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Trellix Mobile Security connector with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up Trellix Mobile Security with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Use Microsoft Tunnel VPN with iOS/iPad devices that don't enroll with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add support for Mobile Application Management (MAM) for iOS to the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. Tunnel support for MAM expands access to your organizational resources for devices that can't or haven't enrolled with Microsoft Intune. Admins should use this article to create policies that support per-app VPN in line of business (LOB) apps.

item.title: Use Windows compatibility reports for Windows updates in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the app and driver compatibility reports for Windows devices before you deploy Intune policies for feature updates or update rings.

item.title: Audit logs for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get audit logs for Microsoft cloud public key infrastructure (PKI) activity in the admin center.

item.title: Enable use of Windows diagnostic data by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows diagnostic data in processor configuration for your tenant to enable its use by Microsoft Intune.
